definition: to roar with laughter/hoots of laughter/guffaw
tumult/uproar/commotion/disturbance
to deceive/to coax/to amuse (a child)
variant of 鬨|哄[hong4]
roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)
old variant of 笑[xiao4]
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: There was a laugh which he cut off brusquely with a gesture.
sentences.chinese: 人们发出一阵哄笑，他做了个手势，猛然制止了笑声。

sentences.english: People began to talk and laugh.
sentences.chinese: 人们开始交头接耳并且哄笑。

sentences.english: All the ministers laughed and Solomon himself smiled.
sentences.chinese: 众大臣哄笑，所罗门自己也微微一笑。

sentences.english: All the boys burst out into a guffaw at the joke.
sentences.chinese: 他的话引起大家一阵哄笑。

sentences.english: What he said aroused a blast of guffaw.
sentences.chinese: 他的话引起大家一阵哄笑。

sentences.english: This one view however call in the netizen's cachinnation .
sentences.chinese: 这一说法却召来了网友的哄笑。

sentences.english: Whistle and laughter sound suddenly coming from all sides.
sentences.chinese: 口哨声和哄笑声顿时从四面八方传来。

sentences.english: The entire gallery was engulfed in peals of laughter.
sentences.chinese: 整个走廊立刻就被一阵阵的哄笑声淹没了。

sentences.english: About halfway through, a bus full of laughing kids went by.
sentences.chinese: 尿到一半的时候，一辆公车路过，满载着哄笑的孩子。

sentences.english: The audience laughed the performer out of the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 观众用哄笑把那个表演者赶出了剧场。

sentences.english: The dancer was laughed off the stage.
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈演员被一片哄笑声赶下了舞台。

sentences.english: The chair sternly rebuked the audience for their laughter.
sentences.chinese: 主席厉声斥责听众哄笑。

definition: the whole room roaring with laughter (idiom)
boisterous/uproarious
to heckle/rowdy jeering/to create a disturbance
to snigger/to titter
to whisper
variant of 嘩然|哗然[hua2 ran2]
in uproar/commotion/causing a storm of protest/tumultuous
clamorous/noisy/sensational/very exciting
to sway to and fro/to rock back and forth
to whisper to one another's ear
laughter
to shout/to bellow one's grievances
lively discussion with everybody talking at once
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
to discuss spiritedly (idiom)/tongues are wagging
